intro: Tragia okanyua, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tragia okanyua is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
